metadata.title: CVE-2022-0298 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in Scheduling in Google Chrome prior to 97.0.4692.99 alloweda remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0298` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 99.0.4844.51-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 99.0.4844.51-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 99.0.4844.51-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 99.0.4844.51-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 99.0.4844.51-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '99.0.4844.51-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
